853DF6DB9B4E4D11A58ECE0AA9318AF6.description:
Use 
suggested
 resources, such as technology, 
individuals
, organizations, 
and 
institutions
 in the community, to gain information about classical Roman 
culture.

BC87FACAEE0B433BBB2A97F6E5E11970.description:
Present examples
 of the Latin language and classical Roman culture evident in 
media, entertainment, and occupations.

9ABF6E745E1E41A2970ABE866D2B5FF3.description:
The student will begin to apply knowledge of the
 Latin language and Roman culture
beyond the classroom setting to explore
 recreational, educational, and occupational 
opportunities
.

CF535CDAEE1D4740B859DC7AC7FC2C78.description: Demonstrate an awareness of unique elements of the studentâ€™s own culture.

0D74ADA11C3143129A1FE49D0FAE86F6.description:
Compare and contrast elements of the
 cultures of Rome and the United States,
such as eating habits, clothing styles, educational practices, architectural 
styles, and family and social structures.

5C4D146EE2684FA78BCCC7798EE636D6.description:
The student will demonstrate understanding of the significance of culture through 
comparisons of
 the cultures of Rome and the United States.

32DCFEA7599443359C6F92D15747C9CD.description:
Compare and contrast t
he sound systems of Latin and English.

2A93CE1AEFDB4FD7A86C07E39129E9A9.description:
Recognize and i
nterpret the Latin roots, prefixes, and suffixes that appear in 
English words.

4469A3BD1468434C8FD921574AF0BF00.description:
Recognize that the basic language patterns of Latin differ significantly from 
those of English.

0F8475395EA94900ABF8D0F54767821F.description:
The student will compare basic elements of the Latin language
 to those of the 
English language.

1E922947BFB24D58BCEE7011ED0B7B6B.description:
Relate content from other subject areas to topics discussed in Latin class, such 
as mythology, current events,
 geography, history, art, and architecture.

6DFC8198146D4F758591B7E6C34A6676.description:
Give examples of the use
 of Latin 
derivatives,
 numerals, mottoes, phrases, and 
symbols in other subject areas.

BE29FF3D396241069F99D158D442BBF1.description:
The student will connect information about the Latin language and Rom
an culture 
with concepts studied in other subject areas.

2D38601D96E14E22A3CDC0C8A5D8ABFC.description:
Examine ways geography and h
istory influenced practices and perspectives of 
the Romans, such as the founding of Rome near the Tiber River 
and conquest 
of the Mediterranean.

C1BAC71FB866418F80F9A820431F3BD0.description:
Recognize that products of the Roman world reflect practices and perspectives 
of Roman culture, such as
 justice, 
the toga as the symbol of Roman 
citizenship 
and aqueducts as a symbol of Roman innovation.

1879BEC2DB134DA4A20AE7ED743E41BA.description:
The student will recognize that perspectives, practices, and products of Roman 
culture are interrelated.

C38103A7AFE64482A20FEC446E7FE70F.description:
Participate in simulated cultural activities, such as family celebrations, banquets, and 
festivals.

D93F257272B64E1891B4EE59E39B61AA.description:
Identify 
some
 important historical and legendary figures, events
, and historical 
timelines, 
such as Romulus, the founding of Rome, and the three periods of Roman 
history.

4ABFD76AA7A6447596FE6D87D28F7CEB.description:
Locate major geographical features of the classical world, such as bodies of water, 
mountain ranges, and cities.

3F3D5BFAB20D409381AE52212898C5DE.description:
Examine products of the Roman
s
 peoples, 
such as food, clothing, 
buildings, and art.

50640F766236442FBC3FA44E35B3D7F3.description:
Identify 
and investigate
 practices in Roman life, such as those related to family, 
education, occupations, 
religion
, and social structure.

C6DB137FDEDD4548807F972B1E854591.description:
The student will develop an awareness of perspectives, practices, and products of Roman 
culture

EBA2969C55B742C58CA607C6D3FC7BCB.description: Compose simple Latin phrases and sentences.

74C17F8259AB40C19D4A0139CE8C1151.description:
Respond appropriately to simple oral and written questions, statements, and 
commands.

76D46333AC93427AA9548F8C073D2ECE.description: Recognize and reproduce the sounds of Latin vowels, consonants, and diphthongs, according to a consistent standard pronunciation.

E6C374A1EE304D5F8B548296B55722FE.description:
The student will use Latin orally and listen to and write Latin as part of the language
-
learning process.

B19992BC9F9B4650AFCA14DA2FB342BB.description: Demonstrate knowledge of basic Latin vocabulary, inflections, and syntax.

0A8FC069EB1E442CA54CD6FB624E16D2.description:
Demonstrate reading comprehension by answering simple questions about Latin 
passages.

F700569A71EF4280844E2051DD150105.description: Read words, phrases, simple sentences, and short passages.

54B3EF9C5D1F49A4B02519CEDDB2C959.description: The student will understand simple written Latin texts about a variety of topics.
